title.value: AU Commonwealth Seniors Health Card Number

publisher.value: Health Level Seven Australia (Patient Administration WG)

description.value: This identifier profile defines a Commonwealth Seniors Health Card number in an Australian context. This definition supports sending the Centrelink Customer Reference Number (CRN) (also referred to as Unique Identifier Number (UIN) in the Centrelink Concession electronic System (CCeS)) as displayed on the individual's Commonwealth Seniors Health Card. An individual's CRN is present as the primary identifier different concession cards and is used to confirm concessions by most government agencies and utility providers.

definition.value: Commonwealth Seniors Health Card number as the Centrelink Customer Reference Number (CRN) (also referred to as Unique Identifier Number (UIN) in the Centrelink Concession electronic System (CCeS)) displayed on the individual's Pensioner Concession Card.

short.value: Coded identifier type for Commonwealth Seniors Health Card number
Centrelink CRN as displayed on the Commonwealth Seniors Health Card

comment.value: A Centrelink CRN is a 10 character identifier in the format of 9 digits ending with a letter.
